# Clear Workspace

```{r}
rm(list = ls())
```

# Load Libraries

```{r}
library('tidyverse')
library('broom')
library("ggthemes")
```

# Load data

```{r}
#| message: false
diabetes_data <- read_tsv(file = "../data/03_diabetes_data_augment.tsv",
                          na = "NA")
```

For PCA analysis we drop the observations that have NA values. We will use the observations that are not medicated, and use the anthropometric measures and biomarkers.

```{r}
model_data <- diabetes_data |> 
  filter(medication == 0) |> 
  select(diagnosis, 
         weight, 
         height, 
         leg, 
         arml, 
         armc,
         waist,
         tri_skinfold,
         sub_skinfold,
         gh,
         albumin,
         bun,
         creatinine) |> 
  mutate(diagnosis = factor(diagnosis)) |> 
  drop_na()
```

# Do PCA

```{r}
pca_fit <- model_data |> 
  select(-diagnosis) |> 
  select(where(is.numeric)) |> 
  scale() |> 
  prcomp()
```

# Plot PCA

```{r}
#| message: false
pca_plot <- pca_fit |> 
  augment(model_data) |> 
  arrange(diagnosis) |> 
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = .fittedPC1, 
                       y = .fittedPC2,
                       color = diagnosis)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + 
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_color_colorblind() +
  labs(title = 'Data represented by the first two principal components',
       x = 'Principal Component 1',
       y = 'Principal Component 2',
       color = 'Diagnosis') +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        legend.position = 'bottom') 

pca_plot

ggsave(plot = pca_plot,
       filename = '../results/PCA_plot.png',
       device = 'png')

```

# Variance explained by the principal components

```{r}
#| message: false
pc_variance <- pca_fit |> 
  tidy(matrix = 'eigenvalues') |> 
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = PC,
                       y = percent)) +
  geom_col(fill = 'deepskyblue3',
           alpha = 0.7) +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:13) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,0.4),
                     labels = scales::percent_format(),
                     expand = c(0,0)) +
  labs(title = 'Variance explained by each principal component',
       x = 'Principal Component',
       y = 'Variance explained (%)') +
  theme_bw(base_size = 14) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) 

pc_variance

ggsave(plot = pc_variance,
       filename = '../results/pc_variance.png',
       device = 'png')
```
